page.title: 06TIBBERMORE (1)
page.content: Tibbermore village is at a crossroads four and three quarter miles west of Perth centre. Today there are nine houses but no shops. The stone built school is empty and and deserted since 1979. Evidence remains of a stone fireplace, arched windows and iron ventilators in its three classrooms. Tibbermore church, originally built in 1631, extended in 1841 for millworkers from Ruthvenfield Mill, is also closed. The last service was held on September 9th. 1984. Inside a slate memorial stone dated 1632 to Sir James Murray and his family is built into the wall. Some wooden pews have little doors with locks. Two galleries, east and west, are reached by stairs. Stained glass windows show Jesus baptised by John the Baptist and Queen Margaret.
